New Records: Michael Busch hit two home runs, including a career-long 468 feet, in the Cubs' 6-2 victory over the Rockies
Key Match Events: Cubs ended a three-game losing streak with the win
Michael Busch's RBI single in the ninth inning
Pete Crow-Armstrong's two-run home run in the ninth inning
Cubs' performance with runners in scoring position (3-for-14)
Post-Match Reflections: Cubs' manager Craig Counsell highlighted the importance of the win and the team's resilience
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cal Quantrill returned from injury and pitched 2 1/3 innings
Rockies loaded the bases with no outs in the ninth inning
